docs.text: one of the funniest carry on movies and the third with a medical setting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the main story is about dr . james nookey ( jim dale ) who is disliked by his superiors , frederick carver , head of the hospital ( kenneth williams ) , and dr . ernest stoppidge ( charles hawtrey ) who seems to dislike everyone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they attempt to cause him as much trouble in the hospital as possible and all the blame is laid on nookey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: carver learns of a possible job opportunity from wealthy ellen moore ( joan sims ) on a distant tropical island and gets nookey trannsferred there .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when nookey arrives at this island , he meets gladstone screwer ( sid james ) who has lived on the island just about all his life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: screwer is in possession of a wonderful slimming drug made from natural ingredients .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dr . nookey returns with the drug to england and sets up a new slimming business with ellen moore's financial backing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , nookey and moore face opposition from screwer who goes to england to cash in on the drug , and carver and stoppidge who want to know the ingredients to create a rival drug .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the performances are all very commendable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sid james has a slightly ambiguous character to play this time and he excels in his role .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kenneth williams , as usual , plays the unpopular and cunning head of the hospital .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: joan sims is entertaining as the wealthy benefactor and jim dale should really head the cast with his excellent portrayal of bumbling nookey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: charles hawtrey plays an 'out-of-character' role as dr . stoppidge , the nasty and evil practitioner who wants to knock nookey off his perch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some critics have said that this combination of hawtrey and stoppidge does not work well , but i think that it at least gives hawtrey a new part to play instead of the usual dimwit characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a matter of fact , hawtrey is suitably cunning in the part .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: other regulars in the movie include hattie jacques as the matron yet again ( but this part is probably her most boring 'matron' ) and barbara windsor as nookey's love interest and unofficial 'women's lib' campaigner , goldie locks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both jacques and windsor play their parts well .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: patsy rowlands appears briefly as miss fosdick , and there are very small cameos from wilfrid brambell ( from 'steptoe and son' fame ) and peter butterworth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the jokes are mostly very funny , the story is quite appealing , and the regulars seem interested in what they're doing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although it is another medical carry on movie and some of the jokes are borrowed from previous movies , it still comes out on top ( it is the best medical carry on ) because of the above factors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a must-see carry on movie .
docs.label: positive
